burlap.behavior.singleagent.auxiliary.valuefunctionvis

Class StateValuePainter

  • java.lang.Object
    • burlap.behavior.singleagent.auxiliary.valuefunctionvis.StateValuePainter
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    StateValuePainter2D

    public abstract class StateValuePainter
extends java.lang.Object
    An abstract class for defining the interface and common methods to paint the representation of the value function for a specific state onto a 2D graphics context.
    Author:
    James MacGlashan

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected boolean shouldRescaleValues
      Indicates whether this painter should scale its rendering of values to whatever it is told the minimum and maximum values are.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      StateValuePainter() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      abstract void paintStateValue(java.awt.Graphics2D g2, State s, double value, float cWidth, float cHeight)
      Paints the representation of a value function for a specific state.
      abstract void rescale(double lowerValue, double upperValue)
      Used to tell this painter that it should render state values so that the minimum possible value is lowerValue and the maximum is upperValue.
      void useValueRescaling(boolean rescale)
      Enabling value rescaling allows the painter to adjust to the minimum and maximum values passed to it.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • shouldRescaleValues

        protected boolean shouldRescaleValues
        Indicates whether this painter should scale its rendering of values to whatever it is told the minimum and maximum values are.

    • Constructor Detail

      • StateValuePainter

        public StateValuePainter()

    • Method Detail

      • paintStateValue

        public abstract void paintStateValue(java.awt.Graphics2D g2,
                   State s,
                   double value,
                   float cWidth,
                   float cHeight)
        Paints the representation of a value function for a specific state.
        Parameters:
        g2 - graphics context to which the object should be painted
        s - the state of the object to be painted
        value - the value function evaluation of state s
        cWidth - width of the canvas size
        cHeight - height of the canvas size

      • rescale

        public abstract void rescale(double lowerValue,
           double upperValue)
        Used to tell this painter that it should render state values so that the minimum possible value is lowerValue and the maximum is upperValue.
        Parameters:
        lowerValue - the minimum value of state values
        upperValue - the maximium value of state values

      • useValueRescaling

        public void useValueRescaling(boolean rescale)
        Enabling value rescaling allows the painter to adjust to the minimum and maximum values passed to it.
        Parameters:
        rescale - whether this painter should rescale to the minimum and maximum value of the value function.
